Concur.definition: to happen at the same time 2
Concur.origin: [he shall have power…to make treaties, provided two-thirds of the Senators present " U.S. Constitution art. II"]

1.definition: to happen at the same time

2.definition: to express agreement [he shall have power…to make treaties, provided two-thirds of the Senators present "art. II"]to join in an appellate decision compare
2.note: A judge or justice may concur with the decision of the court but not agree with the reasons set forth in the opinion. Often a separate opinion is written in such a case.
